rev.comment: minor formatting fix, adding internal link
rev.diff:
Line 136: Line 136:
Mobilesyrup's review indicates "From our time with the device, we can safely say there is no going back. Every piece of Android hardware from this day on will be judged not on the speed of its processor or its pixel density but on whether it is running Ice Cream Sandwich. The Galaxy Nexus has a market lead so vast as to be a chasm; the experience is just that much better. [...] Samsung has wisely taken the best design aspects of the Nexus S and Galaxy S II variants and created the first best Android device ever."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/|title=Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (video)|publisher=mobilesyrup.com|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17}}</ref>
Mobilesyrup's review indicates "From our time with the device, we can safely say there is no going back. Every piece of Android hardware from this day on will be judged not on the speed of its processor or its pixel density but on whether it is running Ice Cream Sandwich. The Galaxy Nexus has a market lead so vast as to be a chasm; the experience is just that much better. [...] Samsung has wisely taken the best design aspects of the Nexus S and Galaxy S II variants and created the first best Android device ever."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/|title=Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (video)|publisher=mobilesyrup.com|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17}}</ref>

Charlie White, at [[Mashable]], described the screen as "gorgeous", offering "an exquisitely sharp view", and describing the hardware design as "a spectacular success", concluding "The Samsung Galaxy Nexus is by far the best Android phone Iâve seen yet."<ref>[http://mashable.com/2011/11/17/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus Review]. Mashable.com (2011-11-17). Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> Joshua Topolsky from The Verge stated "It's one of the best smartphones ever made, and with a couple of minor tweaks (particularly to the camera), it could be the best smartphone ever produced."<ref>Newman, Jared. (2011-11-17) [http://www.pcworld.com/article/244225/galaxy_nexus_reviews_of_course_its_the_best_android.html Galaxy Nexus Reviews: Of Course It's the Best Android]. PCWorld. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
